header.#text: Integrated public alert and warning system modernization

short-title.#text: Integrated Public Alert and Warning System Modernization Act of 2013

text.#text: This section may be cited as the

header.#text: Integrated public alert and warning system modernization

{http://namespaces.cato.org/catoxml}enti.#tail: , shall—
{http://namespaces.cato.org/catoxml}enti.#text: Administrator of the Federal Emergency Management Agency

text.#text: To provide timely and effective disaster warnings under this section, the President, acting through the

term.#tail: ) to ensure that the President under all conditions is able to alert and warn governmental authorities and the civilian population in areas endangered by disasters; and

text.#text: modernize the integrated public alert and warning system of the United States (in this section referred to as the
implement the public alert and warning system.

{http://namespaces.cato.org/catoxml}enti.#tail: , the
{http://namespaces.cato.org/catoxml}enti.@value: Integrated Public Alert and Warning System Modernization Act of 2013/s:102/ss:b/p:1

{http://namespaces.cato.org/catoxml}enti.#tail: shall, consistent with the recommendations in the final report of the
(established under
{http://namespaces.cato.org/catoxml}enti.#text: Integrated Public Alert and Warning System Advisory Committee
{http://namespaces.cato.org/catoxml}enti.@value: Integrated Public Alert and Warning System Advisory Committee
Integrated Public Alert and Warning System Modernization Act of 2013/s:102/ss:c

text.#text: In carrying out
establish or adopt, as appropriate, common alerting and warning protocols, standards, terminology, and operating procedures for the public alert and warning system;

include in the public alert and warning system the capability to adapt the distribution and content of communications on the basis of geographic location, risks, or personal user preferences, as appropriate;

include in the public alert and warning system the capability to alert and warn, and provide the equivalent amount of information to individuals with disabilities and individuals with access and functional needs;

{http://namespaces.cato.org/catoxml}enti.#tail: , as appropriate;

text.#text: ensure that training, tests, and exercises are conducted for the public alert and warning system and that the system is incorporated into other training and exercise programs of the

establish and integrate into the National Incident Management System a comprehensive and periodic training program to instruct and educate Federal, State, tribal, and local government officials in the use of the Common Alerting Protocol enabled Emergency Alert System;
conduct, at least once every 3 years, periodic nationwide tests of the public alert and warning system; and
ensure that the public alert and warning system is resilient, secure, and can withstand acts of terrorism and other external attacks.
The public alert and warning system shall—
incorporate multiple communications technologies;
be designed to adapt to, and incorporate, future technologies for communicating directly with the public;

to the extent technically feasible, be designed to provide alerts to the largest portion of the affected population, including nonresident visitors and tourists and individuals with disabilities and access and functional needs, and improve the ability of remote areas to receive alerts;
promote local and regional public and private partnerships to enhance community preparedness and response;

provide redundant alert mechanisms if practicable so as to reach the greatest number of people regardless of whether they have access to, or utilize, any specific medium of communication or any particular device; and
include a mechanism to ensure the protection of individual privacy.

{http://namespaces.cato.org/catoxml}enti.#tail: , the

and the
and the

{http://namespaces.cato.org/catoxml}enti.#tail: a detailed plan to implement the public alert and warning system. The plan shall include a timeline for implementation, a spending plan, and recommendations for any additional authority that may be necessary to fully implement this subsection.
{http://namespaces.cato.org/catoxml}enti.#text: Committee on Homeland Security and Governmental Affairs of the Senate

header.#text: National urban search and rescue response system

text.#text: In this section, the following definitions apply:

{http://namespaces.cato.org/catoxml}enti.#text: Administrator of the Federal Emergency Management Agency

text.#text: The term
The term

{http://namespaces.cato.org/catoxml}enti.@value: Robert T. Stafford Disaster Relief and Emergency Assistance Act/s:602

term.#tail: has the meaning given that term by

text.#text: The term

term.#tail: means a System member not employed by a sponsoring agency or participating agency.

text.#text: The term

term.#tail: means a State or local government, nonprofit organization, or private organization that has executed an agreement with a sponsoring agency to participate in the System.

text.#text: The term

{http://namespaces.cato.org/catoxml}enti.#tail: to participate in the System.

term.#tail: means a State or local government that is the sponsor of a task force designated by the

text.#text: The term

term.#tail: means the National Urban Search and Rescue Response System to be administered under this section.

text.#text: The term

term.#tail: means an individual who is not a full-time employee of the Federal Government and who serves on a task force or on a System management or other technical team.

text.#text: The term

{http://namespaces.cato.org/catoxml}enti.#tail: to participate in the System.

term.#tail: means an urban search and rescue team designated by the

text.#text: The term

{http://namespaces.cato.org/catoxml}enti.#tail: shall continue to administer the emergency response system known as the National Urban Search and Rescue Response System.

text.#text: Subject to the requirements of this section, the

{http://namespaces.cato.org/catoxml}enti.#tail: shall provide for a national network of standardized search and rescue resources to assist States and local governments in responding to hazards.

text.#text: In administering the System, the

{http://namespaces.cato.org/catoxml}enti.#tail: shall designate task forces to participate in the System. The
shall determine the criteria for such participation.

text.#text: The

{http://namespaces.cato.org/catoxml}enti.#tail: shall enter into an agreement with the sponsoring agency with respect to the participation of each task force in the System.

text.#text: Each task force shall have a sponsoring agency. The

A task force may include, at the discretion of the sponsoring agency, one or more participating agencies. The sponsoring agency shall enter into an agreement with each participating agency with respect to the participation of the participating agency on the task force.

A task force may also include, at the discretion of the sponsoring agency, other individuals not otherwise associated with the sponsoring agency or a participating agency. The sponsoring agency of a task force may enter into a separate agreement with each such individual with respect to the participation of the individual on the task force.

{http://namespaces.cato.org/catoxml}enti.#tail: shall maintain such management teams and other technical teams as the
determines are necessary to administer the System.

text.#text: Service as a System member is deemed

text.#text: If a System member holds a valid license, certificate, or other permit issued by any State or other governmental jurisdiction evidencing the member’s qualifications in any professional, mechanical, or other skill or type of assistance required by the System, the System member is deemed to be performing a Federal activity when rendering aid involving such skill or assistance during a period of appointment into Federal service under

{http://namespaces.cato.org/catoxml}enti.#tail: shall establish and maintain an advisory committee to provide expert recommendations to the
in order to assist the
in administering the System.

text.#text: The
The advisory committee shall be composed of members from geographically diverse areas, and shall include—
the chief officer or senior executive from at least three sponsoring agencies;
the senior emergency manager from at least two States that include sponsoring agencies; and
at least one representative recommended by the leaders of the task forces.

{http://namespaces.cato.org/catoxml}enti.#tail: shall not apply to the advisory committee under this subsection.

{http://namespaces.cato.org/catoxml}enti.#text: Section 14(a)(2) of the Federal Advisory Committee Act
{http://namespaces.cato.org/catoxml}enti.@value: Federal Advisory Committee Act/s:14/ss:a/p:2
usc-appendix/5

{http://namespaces.cato.org/catoxml}enti.#tail: shall enter into an annual preparedness cooperative agreement with each sponsoring agency. Amounts made available to a sponsoring agency under such a preparedness cooperative agreement shall be for the following purposes:

text.#text: Subject to the availability of appropriations for such purpose, the
Training and exercises, including training and exercises with other Federal, State, and local government response entities.
Acquisition and maintenance of equipment, including interoperable communications and personal protective equipment.
Medical monitoring required for responder safety and health in anticipation of and following a major disaster, emergency, or other hazard, as determined by the

{http://namespaces.cato.org/catoxml}enti.#tail: , amounts made available for cooperative agreements under this subsection that are not expended shall be deposited in an agency account and shall remain available for such agreements without fiscal year limitation.

text.#text: Notwithstanding

{http://namespaces.cato.org/catoxml}enti.#tail: shall enter into a response cooperative agreement with each sponsoring agency, as appropriate, under which the
agrees to reimburse the sponsoring agency for costs incurred by the sponsoring agency in responding to a major disaster or emergency.

text.#text: States and the Administrator of the Emergency Management Assistance Compact shall be eligible to receive grants under
A grant received under this section shall be used—
to carry out recommendations identified in the Emergency Management Assistance Compact after-action reports for the 2004 and 2005 hurricane seasons;
to administer compact operations on behalf of States, as such term is defined in the compact, that have enacted the compact;

{http://namespaces.cato.org/catoxml}enti.#tail: and appropriate Federal agencies;

text.#text: to continue coordination with the
to continue coordination with States and local governments and their respective national organizations; and
to assist State and local governments, emergency response providers, and organizations representing such providers with credentialing the providers and the typing of emergency response resources.

{http://namespaces.cato.org/catoxml}enti.#tail: shall consult with the Administrator of the Emergency Management Assistance Compact to ensure effective coordination of efforts in responding to requests for assistance.
